title: 108_s864
content: The "National Guard and Reserves Child Care Relief Act" authorizes appropriations for child care assistance for military dependents under the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. $10,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2004 to 2008 for this purpose. The Secretary will provide grants to eligible persons to help pay for child care services for dependents by eligible child care providers. Eligible persons are parents of dependents of reserve component members on active duty for more than 30 days in support of a military operation. The Secretary provides grants to eligible parents of dependents of reserve component members on active duty for more than 30 days in support of a military operation. The eligible parent must have primary responsibility for the care of the dependents and reside at least 50 miles from the nearest military installation with child care facilities. The term 'military operation' refers to specific operations of the United States Armed Forces, including Operation Enduring Freedom, Operation Iraqi Freedom, Operation Noble Eagle, or any successor operation. To be eligible for a grant, the parent must reside at least 50 miles away from a military installation with child care facilities funded by the Department of Defense. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a person must submit an application to the Secretary with information about the child care provider. The provisions of this subchapter, excluding certain sections, do not apply to assistance provided under this section. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amends Section 658O of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 by updating references to appropriated funds.
